alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan, Chatham and Liberty. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a cluster of thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall over Fort Mcallister tracking north. These storms were producing heavy rainfall rates, ranging between 1.5 to 2.5 inches an hour. Torrential downpours will push over Richmond Hill and across a portion of Interstate 95. Motorist should expect to encounter flooded roads in the Richmond Hill area this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richmond Hill, Coffee Bluff, Montgomery, Keller, Burroughs, Belfast, Fort Mcallister, Skidaway Island, Brisbon, Port Royal, Rabbit Hill, Dunham Marsh, Daniel, Sweet Hill, Oak Level, Georgetown, Limerick and Fleming.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
